intro: Psychotria macropodantha, commonly known as the large-footed Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Psychotria macropodantha is known for its chemical complexity, producing various alkaloids that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
